Legal_Issue: Whether the layoff was due to legitimate reorganization or unjust dismissal
Evidence_Assessment: Employer provided evidence of large-scale restructuring and non-discriminatory layoff criteria; no evidence of bad faith
Decision_Outcome: Adjudicator found layoff was not unjust dismissal
Burden_of_Proof: Employer must prove economic justification and reasonable criteria for layoffs
Credibility_Factor: No evidence of subterfuge or discriminatory intent found
Legal_Rule: Under Canada Labour Code s. 242(3.1), layoffs due to lack of work or discontinuance of function are not unjust dismissals
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged discriminatory practices and illegitimate reorganization
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed; termination upheld as justified
Decision_Maker: Adjudicator under the Canada Labour Code
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process found to be procedurally fair
Key_Evidence_Considered: Scale of restructuring, layoff criteria, absence of discriminatory patterns
Legal_Framework: Federal labour law, administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged legitimacy of reorganization and fairness of termination
Defendant_Response: Layoffs were part of legitimate, economically justified reorganization
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, organizational records, layoff criteria documentation
Remedy_Sought: Overturning of adjudicator's decision on grounds of unjust dismissal
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative adjudication followed by judicial review
